alert.note: Alert for Banner; Box Butte; Cheyenne; Dawes; Kimball; Morrill; North Sioux; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 13 at 3:34PM CST until December 15 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulating through Wednesday. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...The highest additional snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches can be expected in a corridor from Douglas to Chadron. 6 to 12 additional inches can be expected in between Scottsbluff, Chugwater, Kimball, and Sidney. 2 to 6 additional inches can be expected in a corridor from Wheatland to Alliance. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Banner; Box Butte; Cheyenne; Dawes; Kimball; Morrill; North Sioux; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux
